H0.text: The nervous and respiratory systems maintain the level of glucose in the blood.

H1.text: Digestive and endocrine systems maintain the level of glucose in the blood.

H2.text: Muscular and immune systems maintain the level of glucose in the blood.

H3.text: Skeletal and cardiac systems maintain the level of glucose in the blood.

A4.text: Fetal insulin is responsible for increasing glucose uptake and lipogenesis during the stages leading up to birth.

A5.text: The endocrine system is a messenger system in an organism comprising feedback loops of hormones that are released by internal glands directly into the circulatory system and that target and regulate distant organs.
